valueString:
EXAM: MRI BRAIN W/WO CONTRAST


INDICATION: schwannomatosis and multiple schwannomas of the head, neck, chest and arms, new pain, new cranial nerve loss  


COMPARISONS: MRI brain 09/22/2011


TECHNIQUE: Multiplanar multisequence pre and post contrast MR sequences through the head/brain.


CONTRAST: 8mL Gadavist IV. 


BRAIN FINDINGS:
Brain Parenchyma: No acute hemorrhage, cerebral edema, or acute cortical infarction. No mass, mass effect, or midline shift.
Ventricles and Sulci: Normal for age.  
Extra-Axial Spaces: No extra-axial fluid collection.
Intracranial Flow-Voids: Arterial and venous sinus flow voids appear normal.


Orbits: Normal.
Paranasal Sinuses: Normal.
Mastoid Sinuses: Normal.
Cranium: Normal.
Extracranial Soft Tissues: Enlarging T2 hyperintense and contrast-enhancing schwannomas in the anterior left masticator space/left retro-trigone region, posterior parotid and posterior auricular. The largest lesion in the anterior masticator space 
increase from 2.6 x 1.2 cm to 2.7 x 1.5 cm. The lesion posterior to the left parotid gland now measures 1.2 cm from 0.5 cm before, and the left articular lesion is new.The previously left occipital lobulated mass is minimally included on the coronal 
postcontrast sequence and not completely evaluated on this exam. 


Normal internal auditory canals as well as both 7th and 8th cranial nerves normal bilateral vestibular cochlear apparatus. No mass in the cerebellopontine angle. Normal appearance of both Meckel's kidneys. Normal trigeminal nerves.
